alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mower and Dodge Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blooming Prairie, or 10 miles northwest of Austin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hayfield around 650 PM CDT. Claremont around 655 PM CDT. Dodge Center around 700 PM CDT. Kasson around 705 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Eden, County Roads 6 And 15, Brookside Campground, County Roads 5 And 6, Wasioja, Highway 56 And County 6, Graves Landing Field, Waltham, Highway 30 And County 3 and County Roads 6 And 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
